list_definition.definition: to have wide, staring eyes (eg because of surprise)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He goggled at the amount of money he received.

list_ex_of_english: Joshua's invention works by pouring water into the syringes on either side of the goggle-like spectacles.
The timing of the recognition was a bit of a goggle in terms of industrial relations.
He is a science nerd, and is often seen around the school wearing a lab coat and goggles.
For automobiling, boys wore a duster with knickerbockers, a flat cap, and goggles.
The mission was to be flown all at night with night-vision goggles.
The flare blinds the colonel and his men, who were all wearing night vision goggles.
The user should wear rubber gloves and, in tight airless spaces, goggles.
His motorcycle goggles leaked water, yet they protected his eyes from water splashes during his breaststroke-only swim.
